In an effort to not forget what I most want to remember about the places I visit, I usually jot down notes about what I'm thinking about and try to take lots of pictures. I've left a few of them here. :)

![A hand-drawn travel map showing a route through southern Germany and Austria. The map marks Munich (Days 0-3, 7, 8) and a train line to Mittenwald (Days 4 and 5), and Isar-Ursprung Quelle (Day 6), with simple mountain sketches along the border between Germany and Austria.](figures/IMG_8061.png)
**

## Days 0-3: Munich

The first days of my visit include lots of biking, coffee, sweet treats, and perusing.

![A view from a bridge at sunset, showing several people sitting on the structure.](figures/IMG_7725.png)
*The bridge Donnersbergerbrücke overlooks a railyard; the structure of the supports make them a pleasant place to sit and watch the sunset.*

![A top-down view of my friend's kitchen as she's in the process of making bagels.](figures/IMG_7745.png)
*Johanna, making bagels. I learn that the literal translation for “oven mitts” in German is “hand shoes.”*

I walk into a coffee shop and hear a Chicago rapper, Smino, playing. I learn that staring is not considered impolite here.

![The tan brick facade of a large estate.](figures/IMG_7759.png)
**

![A green field full of people playing volleyball and lying on blankets.](figures/IMG_7763.png)
**



![A typical bike lane in the city; a 2m wide concrete segment is flanked by one side with a cobbled sidewalk, and on the other side with a grassy patch and then the road.](figures/IMG_7790.png)
*Biking around, no car-dodging necessary.*

After I order what the waiter describes as a "light mixed plate" and receive nine sausages on a bed of sauerkraut, I resolve to overindex on pretzels for the remainder of the trip.

## Days 4-6: Mittenwald

Woke up feeling anxious about the journey from Munich to Mittenwald. Had an incredible coffee (Roca Junior!) and managed to catch the right trains. From here, I start taking many more pictures.

![A picturesque Alpine village scene with traditional Bavarian houses surrounding a wildflower meadow, while dramatic rocky mountain peaks dominate the background under a blue sky with scattered clouds.](figures/IMG_7878.png)
**

The only depictions of Bavaria I've encountered in the U.S. are at theme parks and fairs; as I walked through the town throughout the next few days, I almost expected to see rollercoasters or something.

The hiking from Mittenwald was absurd. On the first day, I just started walking West of the city into some mountains. On the second, East. On the third, a Friday, my friend Johanna takes off work and drives out to pick me up and cross the border to Austria for another nearby hike.

![An alpine lake framing the same mountain, this time further in the distance.](figures/IMG_7899.png)
**

That evening, we went to my friend’s friend’s birthday party, where everyone was speaking German and the birthday boy was slinging _really_ good pizzas off of his balcony. What a trip.
